events.message: The insured has reported a vehicle collision that occurred on the highway. The claim has been filed to start the process of damage assessment and recovery.
After reviewing the initial report, this case is categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of the insured’s car in a traffic collision.
A claims agent has been assigned to handle the case, responsible for guiding the insured through the claims process and necessary documentation.
The insured has received confirmation from the insurer acknowledging the claim and assuring support in resolving the vehicle accident claim.
The insurer has requested additional documents including police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and witness statements for thorough investigation.
All requested documents including the official police report, accident photos, and repair estimates have been submitted by the insured.
Claims team has commenced an in-depth investigation to evaluate the circumstances of the collision and the extent of covered damages.
The investigation into the vehicle accident is completed; findings support the validity of the claim based on submitted evidence and reports.
A fair settlement amount has been proposed to cover repair costs and damages as evaluated during the investigation.
The insured has responded with positive feedback regarding the settlement offer and the handling of the claim process so far.
Formal approval of the claim has been issued to proceed with the insurance payout and repair arrangements.
The settlement payment has been successfully issued to the insured’s account to facilitate vehicle repairs and cover losses.
The claim file has been officially closed after confirmation that all settlement processes and vehicle repairs are complete.
The case documentation and claim records have been archived securely for any future reference or audit requirements.
